item.title: Text analysis workshop at WZB Berlin
item.description: Workshop at WZB Berlin We will convene a quanteda workshop at the WZB Berlin Social Science Center on January 31, 2018. For the event we have developed a new tutorial website that contains a step-by-step introduction to quantitative text analysis using quanteda.

item.title: Quanteda v1.0 launch at LondonR event
item.description: Quanteda v1.0 launch at London R At a meeting of London R meeting on 16 January 2016, we announced the release of quanteda v1.0. See the presentation here. We thank all the participants and organizers for the great opportunity and the excellent turnout. A video of the presentation is available on the YouTube channel of the Quanteda Initiative.

item.title: Text analysis workshop at ESSSC
item.description: Workshop at ESSSC We will convene a half-day workshop at European Symposium Series on Societal Challenges in Computational Social Science on quantitative text analysis using quanteda.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: About
item.description: Quanteda Initiative Based in London, the Quanteda Initiative is a UK non-profit organization devoted to the promotion of open-source text analysis software. It supports active development of these tools, in addition to providing training materials, training events, and sponsoring workshops and conferences. It’s main product is the open-source quanteda package for R, but also supports a family of independent but interrelated packages for providing additional functionality for natural language processing and document management.

item.title: quanteda
item.description: Quanteda Objectives We develop quanteda to achieve following core objectives in quantitative text analysis. Simplicity and flexibility Create flexible tools for different analytic purposes Provide consistent and intuitive commands for R users Best practice Facilitate transparent and reproducible workflows High efficiency Exploit multi-core CPU’s to process large datasets Store large datasets in small RAMs of laptop computers Inter-operability Allow quanteda to be used in conjunction with other R packages Main contributors Kenneth Benoit Kohei Watanabe Paul Nulty Adam Obeng Haiyan Wang Stefan Müller Ben Lauderdale Will Lowe See Github Insights for other contributors.
